page.title: 19VILLAGE LIFE IN THE TARRANTS
page.content: LIFE IN THIS AREA IS VERY QUIET AND PEACEFUL. THE SMALL VILLAGE HALL IS THE CENTRE FOR SEVERAL ACTIVITIES. THERE IS A CLUB FOR THE SENIOR CITIZENS OF TARRANT RUSHTON, RAWSTON AND KEYNSTON. THIS IS CALLED THE WEDNESDAY CLUB. THE MEMBERS CAN PLAY WHIST AND DOMINOES AND CHOOSE BOOKS FROM A SELECTION ON LOAN FROM THE COUNTY LIBRARY IN POOLE. THERE IS OFTEN A GUEST SPEAKER AND TEA IS PROVIDED. THE LOCAL RECTOR USUALLY CALLS IN FOR A CHAT. OTHER ACTIVITIES IN THE HALL INCLUDE A WEEKLY YOUTH CLUB, FORTNIGHTLY WHIST DRIVES AND OCCASIONAL DISCOS. MOST RESIDENTS SHOP IN BLANDFORD. ONLY A FEW ITEMS, GENERALLY SPEAKING, ARE PURCHASED FROM THE VILLAGE SHOP. MANY PEOPLE GROW SOME FRUIT AND VEGETABLES AND MAKE THEIR OWN CAKES.
